title: What revenue models work best for edtech startups? - Quora

response.answer_text: The subscription model is conquering a service and knowledge market in edtech. It has already become one of the most popular business models in the online education niche. People get accustomed to buying content. But before they usually did it as a single purchase (a DVD or a book on Amazon) and then own it for the rest of their life. Today, we all desire to get new things regularly. We want all new come to our lives without spending too much time searching for them. A subscription model is the way content creators give customers the unique content they produce and provides a number of important benefits to content creators that drive the growth of the subscription economy: What is a membership site and mobile app? - Gurucan (see the guide for more details on each of these benefits) Great monetization strategyA subscription model is one of the most flexible offerings for clients. People can choose a plan they can afford.Long-lasting contentYou do so it by making a course out of your existing content by dividing its knowledge into small pieces.Retention becomes easierYou have long-term relationships with your customers, know your followers better and can satisfy their desires.Simple in pricingSubscriptions usually provide unlimited access to the whole library of courses. They don't need to think about what they want to buy.Freedom for subscribersPeople can browse through all the content and choose what they want to watch next - without deadlines or schedules.

Regardless of whether your startup has raised investment or is totally bootstrapped, the check is as yet ticking in the hunt of a repeatable plan of action. Selling to schools today is different from years past, says Ram. Today, schools expect to see learning outcomes reflected in data. The only problem? “They don’t necessarily know what data, so you have to educate the educators about what outcomes they should expect,” Ram says. He continues: “At some point in the future, your buyer is going to get attacked by somebody else that your product doesn’t work and something else is better. At that point you’ll have to have educated them on how to defend your case to somebody else, and come back to your data source and explain why they were right to choose you.” You can read this article to know more about it : Edtech Business Models That Work - EdSurge News Hope it helps :)
